intro: Cystium platyphyllidium, commonly known as the broad-leafed hakea, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense foliage. The plant typically features narrow, leathery leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often accompanied by modified leaves called bracts. This species is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
